intro: Anaphalis xylorhiza, commonly known as the silverleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage and small, daisy-like flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and sandy soils. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is known for its ability to thrive in arid conditions. Anaphalis xylorhiza is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
